intro: Adamanthus tricarinatus, commonly known as the three-ribbed sycamore, is a deciduous tree native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and palmate leaves with three distinct lobes. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by spherical, woody fruits that split open to release seeds. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
